intro: Erucaria villosa, commonly known as the hairy erucaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in grassy areas or along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
